Renaming column names to Darwin Core terms#

Note: this artice assumes you have generated an initial report. If you have not, go here and follow the instructions.

When we look at our generated report, we notice that a lot of things are missing:

Archive Report
---------------------
Pass/Fail: Fail
Data Type: Occurrence
Errors:
	- A taxonomy report could not be generated, likely because the column 'scientificName' is not in your column names.
	- You are missing required columns in your data.
	- Some of your columns do not match the current Darwin Core Standard.
	- Your datetime format is not in YYYY-MM-DD or iso format.
Missing Columns Occurrence:
	MAYBE: decimalLatitude
	MAYBE: decimalLongitude
	occurrenceID OR catalogNumber OR recordNumber
	scientificName
	vernacularName
	genus
	family
	order
	class
	phylum
	kingdom
Incorrect DwC Terms Occurrence:
	Longitude
	Latitude
	Species
	Collection_date

Occurrence Report
---------------------
Coordinates Report:
	Data has coordinate fields?: False
	Invalid latitude count: 0
	Invalid longitude count: 0
Datetime Report:
	Has invalid datetime: True
	Number of invalid datetimes: 35
Taxonomy Report:
	Could not do a taxonomic classification because 'scientificName' is likely missing from your columns.
Column counts:
	Species: 35
	Latitude: 35
	Longitude: 35
	Collection_date: 35

There are a lot of columns missing. However, if we look at the data we have using the head command of the occurrences dataframe, we can see that none of the column names are terms found in the Darwin Core Standard (for a list of required and recommended terms for your living atlas, see a table of dwc terms).

>>> my_dwca.occurrences.head()

                   Species  Latitude  Longitude Collection_date
0       Corymbia latifolia    -13.04     131.07      2022-03-29
1     Eucalyptus tectifica    -13.04     131.07      2022-09-13
2           Banksia aemula    -33.60     150.72      2022-08-15
3  Eucalyptus sclerophylla    -33.60     150.72      2022-06-16
4        Persoonia laurina    -33.60     150.72      2022-10-19

To rename columns so they match Darwin Core terms, we can use pandas. The following mapping is based on matching the current column titles in the dataset with the names of valid Darwin Core terms that are required by the ALA.

>>> temp_occurrences = my_dwca.occurrences.rename(
...     columns = {
...         "Species": "scientificName",
...         "Latitude": "decimalLatitude",
...         "Longitude": "decimalLongitude",
...         "Collection_date": "eventDate",
...     }
... )
>>> temp_occurrences.head()

            scientificName  decimalLatitude  decimalLongitude   eventDate
0       Corymbia latifolia           -13.04            131.07  2022-03-29
1     Eucalyptus tectifica           -13.04            131.07  2022-09-13
2           Banksia aemula           -33.60            150.72  2022-08-15
3  Eucalyptus sclerophylla           -33.60            150.72  2022-06-16
4        Persoonia laurina           -33.60            150.72  2022-10-19

Now, since the new column names are in a temporary variable, you need replace the old data frame with the new one.

>>> my_dwca.occurrences = temp_occurrences
>>> my_dwca.occurrences

            scientificName  decimalLatitude  decimalLongitude   eventDate
0       Corymbia latifolia           -13.04            131.07  2022-03-29
1     Eucalyptus tectifica           -13.04            131.07  2022-09-13
2           Banksia aemula           -33.60            150.72  2022-08-15
3  Eucalyptus sclerophylla           -33.60            150.72  2022-06-16
4        Persoonia laurina           -33.60            150.72  2022-10-19

Now that we know all of our column headings are Darwin Core compliant, we can check what errors we will get now.

>>> my_dwca.occurrences = temp_occurrences
>>> my_dwca.occurrences

Archive Report
---------------------
Pass/Fail: Fail
Data Type: Occurrence
Errors:
	- There are some invalid taxa according to the backbone you are comparing against.
	- You are missing required columns in your data.
Missing Columns Occurrence:
	family
	class
	order
	kingdom
	genus
	phylum
	coordinateUncertaintyInMeters
	geodeticDatum
	basisOfRecord
	occurrenceID OR catalogNumber OR recordNumber

Occurrence Report
---------------------
Coordinates Report:
	Data has coordinate fields?: True
	Invalid latitude count: 0
	Invalid longitude count: 0
Datetime Report:
	Has invalid datetime: False
	Number of invalid datetimes: 0
Taxonomy Report:
	Invalid taxon present: True
	Valid Taxon count: 0
	Unrecognised taxa:

                          original name                      proposed match(es) rank of proposed match(es)                          scientificName     rank                   species       genus     family     order         classs      phylum  kingdom
0  Eucalyptus camaldulensis var. obtusa  Eucalyptus camaldulensis subsp. obtusa                 SUBSPECIES  Eucalyptus camaldulensis subsp. obtusa     None  Eucalyptus camaldulensis  Eucalyptus  Myrtaceae  Myrtales           None  Charophyta  Plantae
1                       Acacia murayana                        Acacia murrayana                    species                        Acacia murrayana  species          Acacia murrayana      Acacia   Fabaceae   Fabales  Equisetopsida  Charophyta  Plantae
2               Eucalyptus sclerophylla                     Eucalyptus racemosa                    SPECIES                     Eucalyptus racemosa     None       Eucalyptus racemosa  Eucalyptus  Myrtaceae  Myrtales           None  Charophyta  Plantae

Column counts:
	scientificName: 35
	decimalLatitude: 35
	decimalLongitude: 35
	eventDate: 35
None

There are still a few errors, but luckily you can do these in any order in the next section, Validating Data Against DwC Standards
